page.title: 04DE BEERS DIAMOND CORPERATION
page.content: The De Beers Corperation is relatively new to the Sunningdale area:it moved from London in 1975 to be closer to the airport as it was expecting visits from overseas.Sunningdale is not as industrial an area as its neighbour Bracknell but De Beers,nevertheless bought the site including a 1938 built mansion and 23 acres of land(3 of which are now used as a guest area). Being a Diamond Corperation,security is very tight-including close-circuit T.V. cameras.D.B.employs 83 people but only 12 are 'local'.No actual diamond cutting is done on site-it is used for testing products,supplying industrial diamonds and controlling the company's advertising.D.B.supports local charities,the British Association of Young Scientists,the D.B.Poster Scheme ,Ascot United Football Club,the Paul Bevan Foundation and O.A.P/Youth Clubs
